election_record.label: New York 1821 State Senate, Eastern District

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: Richard Goodell received 124 votes as Richard Goodsell.

sub_unit.name: Champion
sub_unit.note: David C. Judson received 4 votes as Daniel C. Judson.

sub_unit.name: Chazy
sub_unit.note: David C. Judson received 4 votes as Daniel C. Judson.

sub_unit.name: Plattsburgh
sub_unit.note: David C. Judson received 1 vote as Daniel C. Judson.

sub_unit.name: Chateaugay
sub_unit.note: David C. Judson received 6 votes as Daniel C. Judson.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: David C. Judson received 2 votes as David Judson.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: George Palmer received 1 vote as George Parmer.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) and The American list Alexander Livingston with 89 votes.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: There were two sets of Tally Sheets for this election. One set listed the candidates as Republicans and Clintonian, while the second sheet gave them as Republicans and Federal. While the candidates on Original Tally Sheets were generally grouped together politically, it was unusual to have their actual party designations reported.
Alexander Livingston received 1 vote as Alexande Livingston and 1 vote as Alexander Livings.

election_record.reference: Original Manuscript of New York Assembly Elections. Michael J. Dubin.
